titleStmt.title: A Briefe and exact relation of the most materiall and remarkeable passages that hapned in the late well-formed (and as valiently defended) seige laid before the city of Glocester collected by John Dorney, Esquire, towne-clarke of the said city, who was there resident the whole siege and appled himselfe wholy to this businesse.

A Briefe and exact relation of the most materiall and remarkeable passages that hapned in the late well-formed (and as valiently defended) seige laid before the city of Glocester collected by John Dorney, Esquire, towne-clarke of the said city, who was there resident the whole siege and appled himselfe wholy to this businesse.
titleStmt.author: Dorney, John, b. 1604 or 5.

notesStmt.note: "Published by authority, and entred into the Stationers Hall-Booke according to order"
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
